54 Pararsco RivEr CROSSING

siderably greater than similar expense for a bridge. The items of expense
for maintaining and operating a tunnel include continuous twenty-four
hour lighting, continuous operation of ventilation equipment to remove
automobile exhaust fumes, continuous availability of fire extinguishing
equipment in order to prevent a catastrophe in the tunnel, continuous avail-
ability of wrecking equipment in order to clear a traffic lane in case of
breakdown, and continuous patrolling and policing in order to maintain
constant communication with the fire protection and wrecking equipment.
These items of maintenance and operation expense would not be required
for a bridge.

DESCRIPTION OF THE PROPOSED BRIDGE
Beginning at the southern end of the bridge and its approaches, and ex-

tending northerly, the bridge and approaches are made up of the following
sections, see Table 20.





TABLE 20
Seet

Highway aDDPLOACH G BUAGE. oo ot vv s vievncms e emes v e 50w o e e 5a s kw8 e mie 8w a0 s 8 i 5 o 8 ens 4 2,913
Overpass over the B&O Railroad tracks...........coviiiiiiiiiieiiiiiiiiiiiiininiiannesansss 1,313
Filled approach SeCtion............... i 786
Elevated highway Dridge QDDTOMEI. ..o « ot vam s dnn o i 5 mi s an 5 0 5 e s = S0 50 8 s &5 0 8 wipims 1,120
Spans approaching the main cantilever unit.............. ... ... . e 2,180
3 Span cantilever unit across the main ship channel.............. .. ... ... ... ... 2,560
Spans approaching the main cantilever unit from the north............... ... .. ... ... .... 2,050
Elevated highway approach................... S BB R RS, § RS 4 R A FIE 0 S B B B A DA AL B 4,970
BAIIEA QD DIORE R v 5 5.5 5o s sy wmsin s o s s e i 350 58 e 9R0 G § 90 768 P % 6 § 04 ¥ 08 B E 0 1,128

The total length of bridge and approaches............... ... i 19,020



A complete plan and profile of the entire bridge is shown on Plate 23 and
a general plan and elevation of the entire project is shown in sections to a
larger scale on Plates 24 to 36 inclusive.

The southern limit is the intersection of Patapsco Avenue and Shell
Road near Pennington Avenue in Fairfield. The northern limit is the in-
tersection of Quail and Boston Streets in Canton. The bridge approaches
reach the existing grades at these street intersections.

The main span across the Patapsco River channel, known as the Fort
McHenry Channel, which forms the main ship channel into the Port of
Baltimore, provides a horizontal clearance of 1000 feet, with 175 feet ver-
tical clearance. The span completely clears the entire width of the dredged
channel and adjacent anchorage basin.
